column4: zsquareplus, i have tried to just assign it an ip that i know it is not using, and i still could not ping even my gateway
zsquareplus, rather an ip that is not in use.
it sounds like a low level hardware problem. if you run sudo mii-diag. is it reporting errors, it the cable type correct?
O wow i didnt know that!
you ran that with root rights? i.e. "sudo mii-diag"?
correct
it is an onboard nic
i just tried again - and i get the same thing " SIOCGMIIPHY on eth0 failed: Operation not supported"

yea, i got that too without sudo. but maybe your network card is not supporting this operation. the tool would have helped to determine if the cable type and speed is correctly negotiated between pc and router/switch.
yea, why not.  "sudo ifconfig eth0 192.168.1.123" for example. with an IP from the private range you use
so now it tells me that my inet has the ip specified, but i can still not acess the internet
does the LED on the router blink if you do a ping of some IP?
yes but i keep getting that the Destination Host is Unreachable

sorry i just realized i didnt make sense there.  I have used this cable and port on the router on a different pc with no problem.   I have also used this computer with a winxp where it worked without connection issues

hm.. well. if the LED on the router and PC is blinking on network traffic it would be a sing that the hardware has a connection. i've seen cases where auto negotiation failed so that router and network card could not communicate
is there any place i can read up on work arounds for that?
right now i have version 8.04 installed.  Would it help to move ti 8.10.
i have the 8.10 release on cd already - i will go ahead and boot up in live first to try it out
8.10 seems to be much the same as 8.04, if i try to force a static - it will connect but i dont seem to be able to even ping my gateway
any last help you can give?  About to give up for today.
not really.. did you search google? maybe with the PCI-id (lspci gives you that one) of the card and linux or ubuntu as keywords?
yeah i have been doing that without much luck which is why i was going to try here.  I might just pull a nic out of a separate computer to try
thanks a lot for your help - ill have to tackle this agian tomorrow.  Have a good one.
